content.description: Boulder your way up the fist two bolts starting on the left of the bolt line and moving across the first bolt to the right. Try to avoid a dirty ledge to the right of the second bolt (watch for rock fall here) and continue straight up the arête  to easier climbing and chains.
content.location: Route nearest the large boulder at the bottom of the gentle hill climber's right of the south cave. First part is in a decent roof and the top half has a distinguished, but small arête .

content.description: Start on two small crimps at about chest height directly below the first bolt. Follow series of crimps and rails/side pulls up to the first bolt. Trend left and use the crimps, but mostly slopers to get through to the second bolt and then chase the easy moves to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchor. Stick clip or pad for some.
content.location: The farthest right bolt line on the wall. A few feet past the "Total Eclipse" boulder look for a more blank slab with some chalked up crimps about 3-4 ft off the ground.

content.description: Climb the fun jugs and crack up to a ledge. Use thin fingers to pop up the final head wall and over the top.
content.location: 3rd route climber's left of the large total eclipse boulder. Large left trending crack up left side of bolt line with a large horizontal ledge 2/3 way up.

content.description: Add 3 grades to the route for the sit start. Route eases after 2nd bolt.
content.location: 4th route climber's right of the south cave.

content.description: This is another climb that starts with bouldering the beginning moves below the first bolt. Start on Kalamazoo or start below the first bolt right of Kalamazoo. Head up to the first bolt then step right to the obvious right facing crack. Several small to med cams will fit into the crack. Do not forget the pink .05 tri-cam. No really, if you can get to the first bolt then the rest of the route is a breeze.
content.protection: Quick draws and several small to med cams will fit into the crack. Do not forget the pink .05 tri-cam. Rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Start on Kalamazoo or start below the first bolt right of Kalamazoo.

content.description: Bouldery start on small holds on the right end of the South Cave and head up to clip the first bolt. Stay slightly left to follow easier holds to the top anchors. Do not move right at the first bolt.
content.protection: Draws used to the rap anchors
content.location: Kalamazoo: Right end of the South Cave which is the beginning of the High Ball Wall

content.description: The expected crux at the beginning, climb the thin rails to the easier finish.
content.protection: 4 bolts + shared anchor with "kiss the sky"
content.location: 3rd line climber's right of the cave. Just in front of a small tree.

content.description:
So Dogwood gets its name from the flowering tree nearby. What a route! Boulder from a sit start if you like or stand and sport up the bolts. I first climbed the line from a sit start, before placing the bolts later. Soloing is not for everyone. 

 Several sit start options exist. Please provide your feed back and suggestions.
content.protection: Bouldering pad or use trad or use the provided bolts and rap anchor. You can toprope but the rock is very hard on ropes.
content.location: Currently the bolted line left of Moon Drip, located 100 feet past the South Cave that's spray tagged!

content.description:
The High Ball Wall starts on the far right side of the South Cave then extends to the south end of the South Wall Area. This wall has the highest concentration of sport climbs, something like 9 or 10 bolted lines, as of 2017. The first route that starts the wall is Kalamazoo. Here is a quick list of the lines.

 Kalamazoo 11a Kalamazoo Crack 11a Excuse Me 10c Kiss the Sky 11a (standing start), 11d (sitting start) Dog Wood 11b (Sit start 1), 12b (sit start 2), 10b (standing start) Moon Drip 10d Two Star Layback 5.9 Total Eclipse 11c Slab Chimp 12a
